plugin.description: The following hosts have an excessive amount of Inodes in use on the local ESXi filesystem. This can cause hosts to disconnect from vCenter and becoming completely unmanageable even locally, requiring a hard reboot. See <a href=`

plugin.description: Failures

plugin.description: The following hosts have certificates that will expire soon and will need to be replaced.
See the Storage/SAN section of the VMware Compatibility Guide or your array/storage vendor's documentation for the supported/recommended policy.

plugin.description: The following hosts are not using the specified power management policy. Power management may impact performance for latency sensitive workloads. For details see Performance Best Practices for VMware vSphere 6.5

plugin.name: Host Swapfile datastores

plugin.name: VMs Ballooning or Swapping
plugin.description: Ballooning and swapping may indicate a lack of memory or a limit on a VM, this may be an indication of not enough memory in a host or a limit held on a VM, further information is available here.
plugin.author: Alan Renouf, Frederic Martin

plugin.name: Multi-writer
plugin.description: The following VMs have multi-writer parameter. A problem will occur in case of svMotion without reconfiguration of the applications which are using these virtual disks and also change of the VM configuration concerned. More information here.
plugin.author: Petar Enchev, Luc Dekens

plugin.name: BusSharingMode - Physical and Virtual
plugin.description: The following VMs have physical and/or virtual bus sharing. A problem will occur in case of svMotion without reconfiguration of the applications which are using these virtual disks and also change of the VM configuration concerned.
plugin.author: Petar Enchev, Luc Dekens

plugin.description: The following server VMs have disks in NonPersistent mode (excludes all desktop VMs). A problem will occur in case of svMotion without reconfiguration of these virtual disks.
plugin.author: Petar Enchev, Luc Dekens

plugin.name: VMs with configuration files (*.vmx, etc) isolated from their disks
plugin.description: The following VMs have their configuration files (*.vmx, etc) stored in a different datastore than their disks

plugin.description: The following VMs have issues with VMTools, these should be checked and reinstalled if necessary
